skill.name: building-native-ui
skill.description: Complete guide for building beautiful apps with Expo Router. Covers fundamentals, styling, components, navigation, animations, patterns, and native tabs.
skill.summary: Complete guide for building native iOS apps with Expo Router. Covers navigation, components, animations, and Apple Human Interface Guidelines.
skill.author: expo

security_audit.summary: Documentation skill containing markdown guides with code examples. Static scanner flagged pattern-based false positives triggered by markdown code blocks (backticks), legitimate documentation URLs, environment variable references, and file path examples. All findings are false positives - the skill contains no executable code, only documentation for Expo Router development.

medium_findings.title: Backtick Pattern in Documentation
medium_findings.description: Static scanner detected backtick syntax in markdown code blocks. This is normal documentation formatting for code examples, not shell command execution. All instances are within fenced code blocks (```tsx, ```) used for React Native/Expo code examples.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: All backtick occurrences are within markdown fenced code blocks showing example Expo/React Native code. No shell command execution exists in this documentation skill.

low_findings.title: Documentation URLs Referenced
low_findings.description: Hardcoded URLs found in documentation files. These are legitimate external documentation links for Expo/React Native resources.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: URLs are standard documentation links to external Expo/Apple documentation resources. No credential exfiltration or malicious network behavior.

low_findings.title: Environment Variable Documentation
low_findings.description: Documentation references to process.env for Expo-specific environment detection. These are legitimate coding patterns for platform-specific code.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Documentation of process.env.EXPO_OS pattern for cross-platform code. This is a documented Expo API pattern, not secret exposure.

low_findings.title: File Path Examples in Documentation
low_findings.description: File path patterns shown in route structure documentation. These are standard Expo Router conventions, not path traversal vulnerabilities.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Documentation of Expo Router file naming conventions for dynamic routes and groups. No actual filesystem operations or user input handling.

content.user_title: Build Native iOS UI with Expo Router
content.value_statement: Building native iOS apps requires understanding Expo Router conventions, Apple Human Interface Guidelines, and platform-specific APIs. This skill provides comprehensive guidance for creating polished native interfaces with proper navigation patterns, animations, and native controls.
actual_capabilities: Creates Expo Router file structures following Apple conventions
Implements native navigation with Stack, Tabs, and Link components
Applies Apple Human Interface Guidelines for iOS UI
Builds entering, exiting, and scroll-driven animations with Reanimated
Integrates native iOS controls like Switch, Slider, and SegmentedControl
Implements search patterns with header search bars and filtering
limitations: Does not cover Android-specific native code or custom native modules
Does not provide backend API implementation guidance
Does not include push notification server setup
Does not cover React Native internal debugging or bridge optimization

use_cases.title: New Expo iOS Project Setup
use_cases.description: Create a production-ready iOS app structure with proper navigation, tab bars, and Apple design patterns from the start.
use_cases.target_user: Developers starting new Expo projects who want iOS-native conventions

use_cases.title: UI Refactoring and Polish
use_cases.description: Improve existing Expo apps with proper animations, native controls, and iOS design guidelines for a more polished feel.
use_cases.target_user: Developers refactoring React Native code to match Apple standards

use_cases.title: Navigation Architecture Review
use_cases.description: Design navigation patterns using shared group routes, dynamic screens, and proper route file organization.
use_cases.target_user: Architects designing complex Expo navigation structures

prompt_templates.title: Create a New Screen
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new Expo Router screen at app/settings/profile.tsx that follows our app conventions. Use a ScrollView with contentInsetAdjustmentBehavior="automatic", add entering and exiting animations, and follow Apple Human Interface Guidelines for the layout.
prompt_templates.scenario: When user wants to add a new route screen with proper styling

prompt_templates.title: Add Navigation Pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a Stack navigation structure to app/(feed)/_layout.tsx with a transparent header, large title, and proper safe area handling. Include a link preview and context menu for the main list screen.
prompt_templates.scenario: When user needs to implement navigation patterns with header customization

prompt_templates.title: Implement Animation
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a scroll-driven animation to the main list using Reanimated v4. The header should fade out when scrolling down and reappear when scrolling up. Use useScrollViewOffset for the animation values.
prompt_templates.scenario: When user wants scroll-linked animations in a list view

prompt_templates.title: Complex Navigation Layout
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a shared group route structure in app/(index,search)/ that allows both tabs to push common detail screens. Use NativeTabs for the bottom navigation with SF Symbols icons. Include proper type definitions for the route parameters.
prompt_templates.scenario: When user needs complex navigation with shared routes between tabs

output_examples.input: Create a settings screen with a form
output_examples.output: The skill generates a settings route file with proper ScrollView wrapping, input fields using expo-text-input patterns, and proper haptics integration for toggle controls.

output_examples.input: Add search to the navigation header
output_examples.prompt: Add a search bar to the Stack header
output_examples.output: The skill creates headerSearchBarOptions configuration with proper search hook integration and filtering patterns for the data list.

output_examples.input: Create a detail screen with liquid glass effect
output_examples.prompt: Create a modal screen with liquid glass backdrop
output_examples.output: The skill generates a form sheet presentation with expo-glass-effect for the backdrop and proper transparent content styling for iOS 26+.

best_practices: Always use ScrollView with contentInsetAdjustmentBehavior="automatic" instead of SafeAreaView for responsive layouts that handle safe areas correctly
Use NativeTabs with SF Symbols icons for iOS tab bars instead of JavaScript-based tab implementations
Apply entering and exiting animations to all screen transitions using Reanimated v4 for smooth native feel
anti_patterns: Never use intrinsic HTML elements like div or img outside of webviews - always use React Native components
Never co-locate components in the app directory - keep route files pure and separate components to a components folder
Never use legacy React Native modules like Picker, WebView, or SafeAreaView - use their modern replacements

faq.question: When should I use npx expo run:ios instead of Expo Go?
faq.answer: Use custom builds only when you need local native modules, Apple targets like widgets, or third-party native modules not in Expo Go. For most apps, Expo Go provides faster iteration and works without Xcode.

faq.question: How do I create shared routes between tabs in Expo Router?
faq.answer: Use group routes with parentheses like app/(index,search)/ to share screens between tabs. Both tabs can push screens defined in the shared group while maintaining separate navigation stacks.

faq.question: What animation library should I use for iOS?
faq.answer: Use Reanimated v4 for all animations including entering, exiting, layout, and scroll-driven animations. Avoid React Native's built-in Animated API for new development.

faq.question: How do I implement search in Expo Router?
faq.answer: Use headerSearchBarOptions in Stack.Screen options for native iOS search bars. Combine with useSearch hook and proper filtering patterns in your data layer.

faq.question: What is the proper way to handle safe areas?
faq.answer: Use ScrollView or FlatList with contentInsetAdjustmentBehavior="automatic" instead of SafeAreaView. This handles both top and bottom safe areas automatically on all iOS versions.

faq.question: How do I add context menus to links?
faq.answer: Use Link.Trigger for the touch target, Link.Menu for context actions, and Link.Preview for iOS-style previews. Add these to enhance navigation on supported devices.
